qas.question: Aside from bombers, what aid did Eisenhower provide to the French?
What did American bombers drop on Vietnam?
When did Dien Bien Phu fall to the communists?
Along with the Vice President and NCS head, who urged Eisenhower to intervene after the fall of Dien Bien Phu?
What arguably impossible conditions did Eisenhower set for further intervention on behalf of the French?

context: Eisenhower did provide France with bombers and <a0_0>non-combat personnel<a0_0/>. After a few months with no success by the French, he added other aircraft to drop <a1_0>napalm<a1_0/> for clearing purposes. Further requests for assistance from the French were agreed to but only on conditions Eisenhower knew were impossible to meet – <a4_0>allied participation and congressional approval<a4_0/>. When the French fortress of Dien Bien Phu fell to the Vietnamese Communists in <a2_0>May 1954<a2_0/>, Eisenhower refused to intervene despite urgings from the <a3_0>Chairman of the Joint Chiefs<a3_0/>, the Vice President and the head of NCS.
